pages.text: Placerias hesternus was a large dicynodont that lived during the Late Triassic in what is now the USA. The robust, stocky anatomy of Placerias has sometimes been compared to that of a modern hippo, though it is thought to have been more terrestrial. It likely used its beak to slice through tough vegetation, and its tusks for digging it up.
